review: This is the best Roku yet for me. It is tiny. You plug it into your tv and plug the power into an outlet and it works perfectly. You can easily travel with it. The one thing to note about traveling with a Roku is that you will need to create your own wireless network as the Roku does not have the ability to sign up for access. There are many ways to do this. I carry a portable router with me and use my laptop or tablet to log the route into the hotel network. Before I leave home I setup the Roku to use my travel router. Then once I have my router plugged in and my network access established, Roku will automatically work. It's really great to have this little Roku. I can use my iPad as a control also, as long as the Roku is already setup for the network. You can also purchase a connector to USB and power the Roku stick off of the tv's USB port, but I haven't tried this yet. The power adapter came with the Roku and was fine for my purposes.
